impact.description: Adversaries may leverage the resources of co-opted systems in order to solve resource intensive problems which may impact system and/or hosted service availability.
Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems or on large numbers of systems in a network to interrupt availability to system and network resources.

discovery.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system.

execution.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.
Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

persistence.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

persistence.technique_name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Search Order Hijacking
persistence.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the search order used to load DLLs.

privilege-escalation.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

privilege-escalation.technique_name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Search Order Hijacking
privilege-escalation.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the search order used to load DLLs.

defense-evasion.technique_name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Search Order Hijacking
defense-evasion.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the search order used to load DLLs.

command-and-control.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with web traffic to avoid detection/network filtering.
